storyTitle: As Employee, I want to filter my schedule by shift type to focus on relevant work periods

testCases.title: Validate schedule filtering by single shift type
preconditions: Employee account exists and is active in the system
Employee is logged into the application
Employee has multiple shift types scheduled (Morning, Evening, Night)
Schedule section is accessible and contains shift data
Filter options are visible on the schedule page

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule section from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Schedule page loads successfully displaying all scheduled shifts with various shift types

steps.action: Locate the shift type filter control on the schedule page
steps.expectedResult: Filter control is visible and displays all available shift type options (Morning, Evening, Night, etc.)

steps.action: Select 'Morning' from the shift type filter options
steps.expectedResult: Filter is applied and schedule view updates within 2 seconds to display only shifts with 'Morning' shift type

steps.action: Verify that only morning shifts are displayed in the schedule view
steps.expectedResult: All displayed shifts are of type 'Morning' and no other shift types are visible

steps.action: Note the number of shifts displayed after filtering
steps.expectedResult: Count of displayed shifts matches the expected number of morning shifts

steps.action: Click the 'Clear filter' button or deselect the 'Morning' filter
steps.expectedResult: Filter is removed and full schedule is restored within 2 seconds showing all shift types

steps.action: Verify that all shift types are now visible in the schedule
steps.expectedResult: Schedule displays all shifts including Morning, Evening, Night, and any other shift types

postconditions: Schedule view displays full unfiltered schedule
System is ready for next operation

testCases.title: Validate schedule filtering by multiple shift types
preconditions: Employee account exists and is active in the system
Employee is logged into the application
Employee has multiple shift types scheduled including Morning, Evening, and Night shifts
Schedule section is accessible and contains shift data
Filter options support multiple selections

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule section from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Schedule page loads successfully displaying all scheduled shifts

steps.action: Locate the shift type filter control on the schedule page
steps.expectedResult: Filter control is visible with all available shift type options

steps.action: Select 'Morning' from the shift type filter options
steps.expectedResult: 'Morning' filter is applied and visually indicated as selected

steps.action: While keeping 'Morning' selected, also select 'Evening' from the shift type filter options
steps.expectedResult: Both 'Morning' and 'Evening' filters are applied and visually indicated as selected

steps.action: Observe the schedule view update
steps.expectedResult: Schedule updates within 2 seconds to display shifts matching either 'Morning' OR 'Evening' shift types

steps.action: Verify that only Morning and Evening shifts are displayed
steps.expectedResult: All displayed shifts are either 'Morning' or 'Evening' type, and no Night or other shift types are visible

steps.action: Count the total number of shifts displayed
steps.expectedResult: Total count equals the sum of Morning shifts plus Evening shifts

postconditions: Multiple filters remain applied to the schedule view
Schedule displays only Morning and Evening shifts

testCases.title: Test no matching shifts message
preconditions: Employee account exists and is active in the system
Employee is logged into the application
Employee has scheduled shifts but none of a specific shift type (e.g., no 'Weekend' shifts)
Schedule section is accessible
Filter options include shift types with no scheduled shifts

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule section from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Schedule page loads successfully displaying all currently scheduled shifts

steps.action: Identify a shift type that has no scheduled shifts (e.g., 'Weekend' or 'Holiday')
steps.expectedResult: Shift type option is available in the filter but employee has no shifts of this type

steps.action: Select the shift type filter for which no shifts are scheduled
steps.expectedResult: Filter is applied and schedule view updates within 2 seconds

steps.action: Observe the schedule display area
steps.expectedResult: Schedule area is empty with no shift entries displayed

steps.action: Verify that a message is displayed to the user
steps.expectedResult: System displays the message 'No shifts match the selected filters' or similar informative text

steps.action: Verify that the message is clearly visible and appropriately positioned
steps.expectedResult: Message is displayed in a prominent location within the schedule view area with appropriate styling

steps.action: Clear the filter or select a different shift type with scheduled shifts
steps.expectedResult: Schedule updates to show matching shifts or full schedule, and the 'no matches' message disappears

postconditions: Filter can be cleared or modified
System correctly handles empty result sets
User is informed when no data matches filter criteria

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to search my schedule by keyword to quickly find specific shifts or notes

testCases.title: Validate schedule search with matching keyword
preconditions: Employee account exists and is active in the system
Employee is logged into the application
Employee has scheduled shifts with notes containing searchable keywords
Schedule section is accessible and contains shift data with notes
Search input field is visible on the schedule page

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule section from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Schedule page loads successfully displaying all scheduled shifts with their associated notes

steps.action: Locate the search input field on the schedule page
steps.expectedResult: Search input field is visible and accessible with placeholder text indicating search functionality

steps.action: Identify a keyword that exists in one or more shift notes (e.g., 'training', 'meeting', 'urgent')
steps.expectedResult: Keyword is confirmed to exist in at least one shift note in the current schedule

steps.action: Click into the search input field and enter the identified keyword
steps.expectedResult: Keyword is entered into the search field and is visible to the user

steps.action: Observe the schedule view as the keyword is entered or after pressing Enter/Search
steps.expectedResult: Schedule updates dynamically within 2 seconds to display only shifts containing the keyword in their notes

steps.action: Verify that all displayed shifts contain the searched keyword in their notes
steps.expectedResult: Each displayed shift has the keyword present in its notes field, and shifts without the keyword are hidden

steps.action: Verify that the search supports partial matches by entering only part of a word
steps.expectedResult: Schedule displays shifts where notes contain words that include the partial keyword

steps.action: Test case-insensitive search by entering the keyword in different case (uppercase, lowercase, mixed)
steps.expectedResult: Search results remain consistent regardless of the case used in the search input

steps.action: Click the clear button (X) in the search input or delete all text from the search field
steps.expectedResult: Search input is cleared and becomes empty

steps.action: Observe the schedule view after clearing the search
steps.expectedResult: Full schedule view is restored within 2 seconds showing all shifts regardless of notes content

postconditions: System is ready for next search operation

testCases.title: Validate schedule search with no matching keyword
preconditions: Employee account exists and is active in the system
Employee is logged into the application
Employee has scheduled shifts with notes
Schedule section is accessible
Search input field is visible on the schedule page

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule section from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Schedule page loads successfully displaying all scheduled shifts

steps.action: Locate the search input field on the schedule page
steps.expectedResult: Search input field is visible and accessible

steps.action: Enter a keyword that does not exist in any shift notes (e.g., 'xyz123', 'nonexistent', random string)
steps.expectedResult: Keyword is entered into the search field and is visible

steps.action: Press Enter or trigger the search functionality
steps.expectedResult: Search is executed and schedule view updates within 2 seconds

steps.action: Observe the schedule display area
steps.expectedResult: Schedule area is empty with no shift entries displayed

steps.action: Verify that an appropriate message is displayed to the user
steps.expectedResult: System displays the message 'No matching shifts found' or similar informative text

steps.action: Verify that the message is clearly visible and user-friendly
steps.expectedResult: Message is displayed prominently in the schedule view area with appropriate styling and clear wording

steps.action: Verify that the search input still contains the entered keyword
steps.expectedResult: Search input field retains the keyword allowing user to modify the search

steps.action: Clear the search input by clicking the clear button or deleting the text
steps.expectedResult: Search input is cleared and full schedule view is restored showing all shifts

steps.action: Verify that the 'no matching shifts' message disappears
steps.expectedResult: Message is no longer displayed and normal schedule view is shown

postconditions: User is informed when search yields no results
